intro: Oldenlandia moandeensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive, waxy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
